Plate 4 bis is in celebration of the anniversary of Tintin magazine.

19.heading: "La Promenade des Anglais" (Robin Dubois) / Turk ; Degroot. p.
19.title: 18-20 in Tintin, ann. 36, no. 317
19.author: [No author]
notes: "Résumé: Nos deux amis sont devenus soldats, bien malgré eux! Enfin, c'était ça ou Cunégonde! le Prince Jean a une mission à leur confier: retrouver Richard Coeur de Lion, disparu aux Croisades!"

20.heading: "La Promenade des Anglais" (Robin Dubois) / Turk ; Degroot. p.
20.title: 35-37 in Tintin, ann. 36, no. 318
20.author: [No author]
notes: "Résumé: Cunégonde gronde! Son bien-aimé shérif part pour la Terre Sainte! Mais le chemin est long pour Folkestone, surtout à pied! Que trame donc Sire Jean? Fair rater leur mission? Pourqoui?"

21.heading: "La Promenade des Anglais" (Robin Dubois) / Turk ; Degroot. p.
21.title: 40-42 in Tintin, ann. 36, no. 319
21.author: [No author]
21.series: Oct. 16, 1981). "Résumé: Nos amis ont embarqué a Folkestone! Le voyage s'annonce sous de très bons auspices, mais pas pour tout le monde! Le mal de mer vient de frapper!"

22.heading: "La Promenade des Anglais" (Robin Dubois) / Turk ; Degroot. p.
22.title: 27-29 in Tintin, ann. 36, no. 320
22.author: [No author]
notes: "Résumé: Le Portugal! Escale de courte durée mais, ô combien salutaire! Vingt-trois jours plus tard, du côté de Marseille, nos amis manquent de tomber dans un guet-apens. Mais on ne piège pas si facilement Robin."

23.heading: "La Promenade des Anglais" (Robin Dubois) / Turk ; Degroot. p.
23.title: 43-45 in Tintin, ann. 36, no. 321
23.author: [No author]
notes: "Résumé: Le voyage se poursuit! Et bien des jours passent! Voici enfin la Terre Sainte. Il s'agit maintenant de dresser le camp!"

24.heading: "La Promenade des Anglais" (Robin Dubois) / Turk ; Degroot. p.
24.title: 8-10 in Tintin, ann. 36, no. 322
24.author: [No author]
notes: "Résumé: La mission commence! Quoi? Retrouver Richard Cœur de Lion! Prudence et discrétion sont de rigeur! Enfin, c'est pas facile de s'y tenir!"

57.heading: Prometheus.
57.title: Green Arrow : Into the Woods
57.author: J
57.appears_in: T. Krul, writer ; Diogese Neves, Mike Mayhew, pencillers ; Vicente Cifuentes, Guillermo Ortega, Mike Mayhew, inkers ; Ulises Arreola, Andy Troy, colorists ; Rob Leigh, letterer.
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form in Green Arrow 1-7, 2010-2011."

Summary (from SkyRiver): Oliver Queen, aka Green Arrow, fights injustice and crime, using his archery skills to become a modern-day Robin Hood as he protects the mysterious forest created by the White Lantern Ring after Star City was destroyed by the villain Prometheus.

59.heading: Prometheus.
59.title: Justice League : Cry for Justice
59.author: James Robinson, writer ; Mauro Cascioli, Scott Clark, Ibraim Roberson, art ; David Beatty, inks ; Mauro Cascioli, Siya Oum, Giovani Kososki, colorists ; Steve Wands, letterer.
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form in Faces of Evil: Prometheus 1, Justice League: Cry for Justice 1-7, 52, 22, 42."

Summary (from SkyRiver): When Batman and Martian Manhunter are slaughtered by Prometheus, their allies Green Lantern, Green Arrow, Shazam, Supergirl, and Starman team together to defeat him before he can attack again.

60.heading: Prometheus.
60.title: Justice League : Rise and Fall
60.author: J
60.appears_in: T. Krul, writer ; Diogenes Neves, et al., pencillers.
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form in Justice League: the rise and fall special 1, Green Arrow 31, 32, Justice League: the rise of Arsenal 1-4, Justice League 43."

"A cry for justice demanded that Green Arrow kill Prometheus, the villian responsible for destroying his city and maiming his protege. But doing so has caused the Justice League's emerald archer to lose sight of his wife, his teammates, his moral code and his freedom. Roy Harper has lost even more: Prometheus took his arm and his daughter, but his mentor deprived him of retribution. Aimless, Roy becomes Arsenal, seeking relief from the inner demons through old addictions. This time, though, he has no desire to fight those demons-or be a hero. Both men are on a collision course that can't be avoided-and neither will try."

61.title: "Prometheus"
61.author: by Jon Macy
notes: Summary: Maria is writing stories of Clovis's love life as though it were her own; Clovis is told to stop scowling if he wants a husband.

62.title: "Prometheus"
62.author: by Jon Macy

63.title: "Prometheus"

65.title: "The Prometheus"
65.author: author, Rich Margopoulos ; illustrators, John Garcie and Rudy Nebres
notes: "The Prometheus had journeyed to the nearest star beyond the Sun to reclaim a heritage that man had lost. Now, almost home again, it faced destruction and Earth's hopes trembled in the balance!"

66.heading: Prometheus.
66.title: "Cody Starbuck"
66.author: by Howard Chaykin
66.appears_in: p. 82-89 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 3 (June 1981).
notes: "Last we saw, Cody Starbuck and his crew, employed by Prometheus, continued their age-old expensive battle against Dax's research into hyperspace. After their victorious attack upon the Dax Corporation, Cody and his cohorts were pursued by the enemy interceptors."

67.heading: Prometheus.
67.title: "Cody Starbuck"
67.author: by Howard V
67.appears_in: Chaykin. p. 34-43 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 6 (Sept. 1981).
notes: "When we left Cody, last issue, he had killed his Prometheus-manufactured clone and was off to avenge this too-close-for-comfort deception. While on his mission, he learnt of the death of his true love, Lady Tessa. She had been executed by Lady Rowena while he was on the planet 1026."

98.author: Pourbet.

"The profession of secret agent knows its own share of troubles but fighting a powercrazed millionaire and his sexstarved, promiscuous wife, as well as coping with an equally sexhungry companion can prove to be too much for the best of men. As if this were not enough, an enormous servant and a ploy for world domination are also brought into play. Meanwhile, the protagonist is subconsciously tortured with sexual fantasies."

126.heading: Promises.
126.title: "The Celestial Necklace : How a Promise Must Be Kept"
126.author: script, Toni Patel ; illustrations, Dilip Kadam ; editor, Anant Pai
126.appears_in: p. 1-31 in Amar Chitra Katha, no. 711 (1980, 2010 printing).
notes: Summary from back cover: "King Shrenika was given a necklace of precious stones by a deva for his good deeds. The deva also told him that if the necklace broke the person who repaired it would die. It happened as the king feared. The necklace broke and Queen Chellana, who was wearing it, insisted that it be repaired. Would anyone string the stones, even for a big reward, and risk death? And if there was such a man, whould the king honour his promise and give the reward to his heirs? This Jain story is based on a retelling of tales from the Agamas (Jain texts) by Muni Mahendrakumar."

127.heading: Promises.

129.heading: Promises.

130.heading: Promises.
130.title: "Don't Make a Promise that You Can't Keep, Loretta!"
130.author: Dal Curtis ; Bradley and Edgington ; Da Silva.
notes: Summary: Dr. Morgan wants Loretta to get help for her alcohol problem.

131.heading: Promises.
131.title: "Drona : Valiant Archer, Supreme Teacher"
131.author: script, Kamala Chandrakant ; illustrations, P
131.appears_in: B. Kavadi ; editor, Anant Pai. 32 p. in Amar Chitra Katha, no. 565 (1974, 2010 printing).
notes: Summary from back cover: "When Drona went to his childhood friend, Drupada, to remind him of his promise of eternal friendship made long ago, Drupada rebuked him and spurned him. Burning with anger and humiliation, Drona was filled with a desire for revenge. That was the only tragic flaw in a brave and supremely talented archer who taught the use of arms to the Kaurava and the Pandava Princes."

132.heading: Promises.

132.author: text by Elettra Stamboulis ; art by Gianluca Costantini
132.appears_in: p. 32-33 in World War Three Illustrated, no. 37 (2006).

133.heading: Promises.

notes: Summary: Mark tries to describe the difficulties of coming out to his mom, hoping she'll try to understand.

134.heading: Promises.
134.title: "I Am Promised to a Young Island Prince I Cannot Abide!"
134.author: by Dan Barry.

135.heading: Promises.

136.heading: Promises.

136.author: Jack Elrod.
notes: Summary: Missy catches Winky in the act, and yells her promise not to tell.

137.heading: Promises.
137.title: "The Iceman Cometh"
137.author: by Alison Bechdel.
notes: Summary: There's a storm, but Ginger makes it home safe. Sparrow has a date with a man (Stuart), whose car hits a phone pole and he arrives on foot and frozen. Lois promises not to carve a cucumber with a cleaver, and in fact gets ready to set up the Parcheesi board.

138.heading: Promises.
138.title: "If I Bring You a Penne Pasta, Will You Promise Not to Build a Log Cabin on Your Plate?"
138.author: Scott Adams.
notes: Summary: The waitress says they have a situation.

139.heading: Promises.

notes: Summary: Hi's all ready to play golf when Lois reminds him he promised to take everybody to the beach.

140.heading: Promises.

notes: Summary: The newspaper headline (being discussed by dogs) says the country is going to the dogs.

141.heading: Promises.
141.title: "Krishna and Shishupala : He was Forgiven a Hundred Times"
141.author: script, Kamala Chandrakant ; artworks, Ram Waeerkar
141.appears_in: 31 p. in Amar Chitra Katha, no. 589 (1978, 1998 printing).
notes: Begins: "The house of King Damaghosha of Chedi was steeped in gloom. What should have been a joyous event turned out to be a nightmare. The long-awaited son, born to Damaghosha and his queen, was a freak, with four arms and three eyes."

Summary from back cover: "Shishupala's mother was shocked when she came to know that her child was destined to be killed by Krishna. She extracted a promise from him that he would forgive Shishupala a hundred offences. As he grew up, Shishupala had enough reasons to be angry with Krishna. Especially after he was jilted by Princess Rukmini, in favour of the merry-eyed cowherd. He provoked Krishna repeatedly and was forgiven a hundred thimes. And then one day Shishupala committed his hundred and first offence."
Subtitle, series and summary from 2010 printing.

notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): Traces the loss of the author's Zionist faith against a backdrop of Jewish history, recounting how his growing disaffection with the modern state of Israel was shaped by the mythologies and realities of the Jewish homeland.

156.heading: Promises.

157.heading: Promises.

Summary (from SkyRiver): Superman faces off against the Silver Banshee, Preus, Doomsday, and, worst of all, Gog, who returns for another attempt to fulfill his promise to kill Superman.

158.heading: Promises.

Summary (from SkyRiver): There's no end to the evils that Superman must overcome: Darkseid's minions, Preus, Weapons Master, and Sodom and Gomorrah, to name a few. But now Gog is back to keep his promise to kill the Man of Steel.

207.heading: Promotions.

Read it now, the fully, juicy details of how Private Joe Yank was transformed into General Joe."

212.heading: Promotions.
212.title: "The Man from Mars"
212.author: script, Stan Lee ; art, Bob Fujitani
212.appears_in: 3 p. in Strange Tales, no. 9 (Aug. 1952) ; reprinted in Beware, no. 2 (May 1973).
notes: Summary: A deadbeat wants to see a movie called 'The Man from Mars' but he's broke. When he sees a rocket ship with a sign that reads 'Be the first to see Mars,' he thinks it's a promotion for the picture and enters. The rocket blasts off and he passes out from the acceleration. When he revives, he's a captive in a Martian zoo.
Data from Bob Klein, Lou Mougin, Martin O'Hearn, et al. via Grand Comics Database.

213.heading: Promotions.
213.title: "A Motor Comedy"
213.author: Arthur Gill
213.appears_in: p. 16 in BOP (The Boy's Own Paper), Christmas 1903.
notes: Four captioned panels in which two policemen think they'll catch an automobile and get a promotion, but instead catch a boy in a soapbox car.

214.heading: Promotions.
214.title: "The New Front"
214.author: J
notes: Summary: A foot foreman is promoted to a desk job, but he's still using his pockets for a desk.

215.heading: Promotions.
215.title: "Now, You'll Get to Clean the Floor One Level Up!"

notes: Summary: A man with a mop gets a promotion.

216.heading: Promotions.
216.title: One Last Date with Archie
216.author: Michael J
notes: Summary: Archie Andrews' dad gets his big promotion, but it means that the whole family will have to move out of Riverdale, much to the dismay of Betty and Veronica.

217.heading: Promotions.
217.title: "Operation Vengeance" 12 p. in Atomic War, no. 2
217.author: [No author]
notes: Summary (by Ed Gildner): New York, Detroit and Chicago have been destroyed by Russian A-bomb attacks. Colonel Ranshaw leads American bombers on a retaliatory mission. The colonel had been promoted to general hours before and was no longer supposed to be leading the mission personally. Ranshaw couldn't leave his men. Despite heavy casualties, the men manage to destroy two cities with A-bombs. Ranshaw improvises and unexpectedly heads for Moscow destroying it with a hydrogen bomb ("the devilish H-bomb!") "We've changed the map of Russia!"

218.heading: Promotions.

220.heading: Promotions.
220.title: "Warpath" 32 p. in Fawcett Movie Comic, no. 13
220.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Movie adaptation. John Vickers is a tough former soldier with one goal in life: to bring justice to the three men who killed his fiancée during a robbery. For eight years he searches, and finally comes upon one of them, Herb Woodson, in Kansas. Woodson dies before he can say more than that the other two, Morrison and Bligh, have joined the cavalry. On the way to Bismark to join the cavalry himself at Fort Lincoln, Vickers meets a young woman named Molly. In the process he beats up a bullying Sergeant O'Hara, who was bothering her. Molly is traveling West to be with her father, Sam Quade, who is the sutler at Fort Lincoln, and whom she hardly knows. Vickers enlists as a private, and O'Hara is his sergeant, and trouble begins right away. The company is called out and soon pinned down by Sioux Indians, and Vickers makes it back to tell General Custer, their overall commander, the situation. Custer promotes him over O'Hara. Molly and John figure out that O'Hara is Morrison and that Molly's father is Bligh. Custer and most of the cavalry are then killed at the Little Big Horn, and Vickers becomes a lieutenant in what's left of the unit, and he has to marry Molly.

"Captain Stupendous is having a bad life. His ex-wife, Mrs. Mind, is marrying a mortal. His eldest son, Kid Liberty, is struggling with his sexual identity. His daughter, Tesla Curl, can't get a date to the prom. And, his mortal middle child, what's-his-name, is, well, mortal."

241.heading: Proms.
241.title: "Here in Your Arms"
241.author: Vincent J
241.appears_in: Colletta. 5 p. in My Love Story, no. 2 (June 1956).
notes: Summary: Middlebury College coed Jane Brooks has a crush on the school football hero, Roy Mason. Because she needs to work her way through school at the library, she doesn't have much opportunity for social activities. Then Roy comes into the library, asking for help in finding information for his term paper. When Jane tells her roommate Helen about the encounter, she is reminded that she isn't likely to be Roy's type. So Jane dates another student, Paul Clark, who is as serious and studious as she. When Paul tells her about his plans to go to graduate school and become a teacher, and that he hopes she will marry him, Jane says it's too soon to think about that. The next day Roy returns to the library for more help. By assisting him, she finds that Roy is more serious than she thought. He asks her to the prom and tells her that asking for help was just an excuse to get close to her, and so, the feelings are mutual.
